titlestmt.titleproper: Guide to the Bloodgood H. Cutter autograph 1974.240
titlestmt.author: Nicholas Pavlik
titlestmt.sponsor: This collection was processed and described as part of the project, "Uncovering the Secrets of Brooklyn's 19th Century Past: Creation to Consolidation," funded by the Council on Library and Information Resources, with additional support from The Gladys Krieble Delmas Foundation.

profiledesc.creation: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace on 2023-08-21 11:19:39 +0000.

did.abstract: The autograph of Bloodgood H. Cutter, cut from a document dating 1888.

acqinfo.head: Immediate Source of Acquisition
acqinfo.p: Source and date of acquisition unknown. Formally accessioned in 1974.

bioghist.head: Biographical Note
bioghist.p: Bloodgood Haviland Cutter (1817-1906) was a Long Island poet who published several collections of poems in the mid- to late 19th century, including The Long Island Farmer's Poems (1886).

scopecontent.head: Scope and Contents
scopecontent.p: The autograph of Bloodgood H. Cutter, cut from a document dating 1888.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: Identification of item, date (if known); Bloodgood H. Cutter autograph, 1974.240, Box and Folder number; Brooklyn Historical Society.

controlaccess.subject: Authors, American -- New York (State) -- Long Island
